title: Quality Improvement (QI) and Health Equity Integrated Education for Strengthening Physician Leadership Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Healthcare System Operations and Leadership Experience, with Basic Statistical Analysis Skills
context.additional_context: Competency-based education for healthcare administrators and decision-makers, designed around multidisciplinary team collaboration and practical projects

learning_goals: Achieve practical competency in systematically integrating the concept of health equity into QI projects.

Within four weeks, learners design a data-driven decision-making process for healthcare system improvement by analyzing hospital operational data (e.g., patient wait times, resource utilization rates), identifying three key problem areas, and proposing two actionable improvement plans with data visualizations (charts/dashboards).

Learners can complete the full-cycle process of planning (defining problem statements, setting specific numerical goals, submitting implementation plans), executing (creating weekly task allocation charts, submitting weekly monitoring reports), and evaluating (writing data-driven analysis reports, submitting at least three improvement proposals) one QI project under the leadership of a multidisciplinary team (5â€“7 members) within four weeks.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
